main event: Two witnesses observed a bright orange light over Rego Park, New York on June 25, 1968 for approximately 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a star without binoculars and the size of a half dollar with binoculars., The observer described the object as resembling a miniature ship with possible portholes., The object moved in various directions, often disappearing and reappearing., The object emitted no sound and had no physical evidence following the sighting., The sighting was reported to the Air Force but deemed insufficient for investigation.
sighted object: bright orange light resembling a miniature ship
